module.p: tro through is the (leniting) perlative preposition.

section.p:
The default form of the perlative preposition is simply tro –
tro thaigh through a house
tro aislingean through dreams
tro Nirribhidh through Norway
tro thrì làithean through three days

When the immediately following word is a singular form of the definite article, the linking form tron is used –
tron an taigh through the house, rather than tro an taigh
tron a’ bhaile through the town, rather than tro a’ bhaile But –
tro na h-aislingean through the dreams, rather than tron na h-aislingean

Fused forms are sometimes found when the immediately following word is a possessive determiner –
tro mo thaigh through my house ≈ trom thaigh
tro do bhaile through your town ≈ trod bhaile
tro a h-òran through her song ≈ tro h-òran
tro a chraoibh through his tree ≈ tro chraoibh
tro ar n-achadh through our field ≈ trar n-achadh
tro ur leapannan through your beds ≈ trur leapannan
tro an taighean through their houses ≈ tron taighean
tro am baile through their town ≈ trom baile
Note that these fused forms are rather awkward and sometimes ambiguous and hence are best avoided in writing nowadays.

Conjugated prepositions are used in place of tro mi, tro thu, ... , tro iad –
tromham through me
tromhad through you
troimhpe through her/it
troimhe through him/it
tromhainn through us
tromhaibh through you
tromhpa through them

There are also emphatic forms (cf. tro mise, tro thusa, ... , tro iadsan) –
tromhamsa through me
tromhadsa through you
troimhpese through her/it
troimhesan through him/it
tromhainne through us
tromhaibhse through you
tromhpasan through them
Note that the form troimhesan breaks the ‘slender-to-slender, broad-to-broad’ spelling rule, and hence is sometimes found written with a hyphen – troimhe-san.

Finally, there are also reflexive forms (cf. tro mi fhìn, tro thu fhèin, ... , tro iad fhèin) –
tromham fhìn through myself
tromhad fhèin through yourself
troimhpe fhèin through herself/itself
troimhe fhèin through himself/itself
tromhainn fhìn through ourselves
tromhaibh fhèin through yourselves
tromhpa fhèin through themselves
